text: Donald Trump's Twitter feed tonight is unbelievably batshit, even for him. How can this be real? But it is.
author: Green_Footballs

text:
..........

Please note that this isn't me speaking -- it's a post by a contributor to Little Green Footballs. I posted that note at the beginning of this thread, but here it is again because I don't want to wrongly take credit for it.
author: Green_Footballs

text: The human race is doomed.
author: Green_Footballs

text: WHARRRGARBL
author: Green_Footballs

text:
I have been broken.

Sorry about rambling. I am just so tired.
author: Green_Footballs

text:
How many people truly think we would kill a baby after it is born? If a baby has a lethal abnormality, you make the baby as comfortable as possible and let the parents hold it. You then try and give them any support you can.

I can’t take this much longer.
author: Green_Footballs

text:
Also, one of my patients had a stillborn. No obvious cause.

Also, try explaining to evangelicals that there is really no such thing as a third trimester abortion. We call it a delivery after inducing for medical indications. That was several times last week.
author: Green_Footballs

text:
Finally, she just got so tired she agreed to the the pitocin and we had the baby in less than 4 hours.

Pitocin is just a brand name of the hormone oxytocin which causes the uterus to contact. It is like saying Kleenex instead of facial tissues.
author: Green_Footballs

text: This week I had to deal with patient who had to be induced because she was sick (as in so sick she would have died before modern obstetrics) refuse pitocin. She then did not understand why she had still not had the baby after 2 days.
author: Green_Footballs

text: We are talking about a lay midwife recommending putting a piece of the placenta in the cheek after delivery if the woman starts bleeding instead of pitocin. This has absolutely no scientific basis.
author: Green_Footballs

text: I can’t handle arguing about basic accepted medical practice anymore. We are talking about Rhogam for Rh negative patients when we know the father is Rh positive. Rh sensitization used to kill many babies.
author: Green_Footballs

text:
Alabama now has lay midwives coming out the woodwork.

These people and their patients are the ob version of flat earthers. You can’t even say they are the ob version of anti-vaxxers since they are all anti-vaxxers anyway.
author: Green_Footballs

text:
Posted tonight by an LGF contributor; the real life consequences of Republican anti-choice propaganda.

............

I am exhausted. This has been a very long two weeks at work.

I have been broken. No more joint care with midwife patients.
author: Green_Footballs

text: Right - by "not a thing" I meant it hadn't taken off publicly yet.
author: Green_Footballs

text: Back then I belonged to an informal Atari users' group that did similar stuff - we figured out how to defeat floppy disk copy protection, how to use disassemblers and debuggers to modify code, that kind of stuff. That's what "hacking" used to mean.
author: Green_Footballs

text: It would have been a little hard to cause a denial of service attack with a 300 baud modem.
author: Green_Footballs

text: Sure, but it wasn't the same as what's going on now. Back then, hackers were just people who were figuring out how to do things with computers.
author: Green_Footballs

text: Yeah, but that wasn't the kind of hacking Dead Cow did.
author: Green_Footballs

text: That too.
author: Green_Footballs

text: Some perspective on Beto O'Rourke as a "hacker" - when he was a teenager, the internet wasn't even a thing yet, and most people had no idea what a network was. In the early 90s, "hacking" was nothing like it is today.
author: Green_Footballs

text: Exactly.
author: Green_Footballs

text:
Man, it really seems like the media has it in for Beto today.

Am I supposed to be upset that Beto O'Rourke was a hacker when he was a teenager?

Would have been nice if this level of scrutiny was applied to Donald Trump in 2016.
author: Green_Footballs

text: Donald Trump and Candace Owens Cited as Inspiration for Horrific New Zealand Terror Attack
author: Green_Footballs

text: Here they come.
author: Green_Footballs

text: This is horrible, but don't kid yourself - this is the same kind of rhetoric we hear from Trump and his followers every single day. It's NOT unusually extreme in the Trump era. It's the right wing norm.
author: Green_Footballs

text: And now we can expect right wing Twitter to start another fake freakout about Antifa or one of their other boogeymen, to avoid taking responsibility for what happened in New Zealand.
author: Green_Footballs

text: Trump's "best wishes" tweet about the New Zealand terror attack isn't just tone deaf and robotic - it's meaningless. Empty words. I think on some level he wants these atrocities to happen, because he refuses to stop his anti-Muslim incitement.

text:
I don't hate Joe Biden at all; in fact, I like him more than a lot of politicians.

But I just think at this point he should retire after a very long and successful career. He's had his day. Time to let some much needed new blood into the game.
author: Green_Footballs
